title.narrative: Strengthening Public Financial Management in Rajasthan

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is: "to contribute to improved budget execution, enhanced accountability, and greater efficiency in revenue administration in Government of Rajasthan".

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :DLIs Verification and Withdrawals | Description :For withdrawals for eligible expenditures under Component 2 ofthe Project, the Borrower, through GoR, shall: (i) carry out a verification process to certify fulfillment of DLI Targets guided bya DLI Verification Protocol agreed with the Bank; (ii) furnish to the Bank the corresponding verification reports in form andsubstance acceptable to the Bank, in order to submit evidence satisfactory to the Bank of the achievement of the DLIs; and (iii)furnish to the Bank the applicable interim unaudited financial reports documenting the incurrence of eligible expenditure. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Nodal Officers | Description :Rajasthan shall ensure at all times during Project Implementation: (i) for eachPart/sub-Part of the Project, a nodal officer from the other Implementing Departments is designated to coordinate with the PMU onthe implementation of activities, monitoring, and reporting; and (ii) the activities under the Project are carried out inaccordance with the Project Implementation Plan. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Management Unit | Description :Rajasthan shall maintain, at all times during Project implementation, aProject Management Unit (PMU) within Rajasthanâ€™s Economic Affairs Division of the Finance Department, for the Project withfunctions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank, including, inter-alia: (i) coordinating activities with the otherImplementing Departments, (ii) taking actions for procurement, financial management, monitoring progress and evaluatingperformance, (iii) ensuring financial reports are available and submitted to the Bank, (iv) hiring technical experts andconsultants; all in accordance with the Project Implementation Plan, and (v) ensure timely funds flow to facilitate Projectimplementation. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Monitoring Committee | Description :Rajasthan shall ensure that, at all times the activities of theProject is reviewed and monitored by a Project Monitoring Committee (PMC) led by a senior official from the Indian AdministrativeServices (IAS), with the composition, functions and responsibilities as provided for in the Project Implementation Plan, assistedby a State project director and adequate professional and administrative staff, whether on deputation on otherwise, includingspecialists in procurement, financial management, budget and treasury, taxation and IT, and other Project related technical staff,in numbers and with experience and qualifications and under terms of reference agreed to between Rajasthan and the Bank. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee | Description :Rajasthan shall maintain, at all times during Project implementation,a Project Steering Committee (PSC), chaired by the Additional Chief Secretary, Finance and comprising inter alia of theSecretaries/Heads of Departments of relevant Implementing Departments as applicable to the Government of Rajasthan to provideoverall strategic guidance to the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Retroactive Financing | Description :No withdrawal shall be made for payments made prior to the date of signingof the Loan Agreement, except that the Borrower may withdraw for payments made before such date but on or after May 15, 2017, up toan aggregate amount not to exceed US$ 4.00 million. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Reversal of DLIs | Description :In the event a reversal of a DLI Target, which has already been verified and forwhich the corresponding disbursements have been made by the Bank, has occurred in a manner that would, in the opinion of the Bank,adversely affect the achievement of the objectives of the Project, the Borrower shall refund the disbursements already made by theBank for such DLI Target. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

baseline.value: Administrative/MIS/transactional data not being used for planning and monitoring purposes.

target.value: Usage of developed indices in planning and monitoring; develop plan on updating indices.

actual.value: Status: YR1, YR2 and YR3: Achieved.

title.narrative: Improving effectiveness of Tax Audit in the Commercial Taxes Department (CTD)

actual.value: Status: YR1: Achieved Year 3 Target: Audit hit rate improves to 15%Status YR2 and YR3: Pending achievement.

title.narrative: Institutional strengthening of internal audit (IA) function

baseline.value: Audit setup needs strengthening; Outdated manual, rules, circulars, and processes.

target.value: Modernized Internal Audit Manual developed and action plan for implementation notified.

actual.value: Status: YR 1, YR2 and YR3: Achieved.

title.narrative: Strengthened budget execution by improving controls over commitment

baseline.value: Commitment Control System does not exist

target.value: CCS being used in 20 (twenty) departments covering 90% of their capital expenditure above threshold as established by the policy

actual.value: YR2: Achieved YR3: Target: Policy on Commitment Control approved and notified by GoR; Policy, procedures/ guidelines andsoftware solution implemented in 10 (ten) (cumulative) departments.Status: Under progress

title.narrative: Improve debt management - Enhance transparency and systemize procedures

baseline.value: Debt records are manual and not centralized. Consolidated and electronic debt recording system does not exist.MTDS is notprepared.DSA does not include shocks and scenario analysis. Dedicated debt statistical bulletin not prepared.

target.value: Strengthened debt management - reliable MTDS, DSA prepared; consolidated debt database used to prepare analytical outputs.

title.narrative: Strengthened public procurement framework and capacity (including training of minimum 5% female employees of the department)

baseline.value: Draft SBDs for new contracting methods under preparation.Lack of institutionalized public procurement training system withlimited outreach.No database of debarred firms.

target.value: SBDs notified and published.Database of debarred firms developed.Procurement capacity of the officials enchanced.

actual.value: Year 3: Target : 4,000 officials trained and certified in public procurementStatus: Year 1 - Achieved. Year 2 - Achieved. Year3 - Pending due to delay in hiring of consultants, procurement process now underway.

title.narrative: Reduced delays by making awards within initial bid validity period in ten identified departments

baseline.value: Estimated 50% contracts are awarded within initial bid validity period.

target.value: 90% contracts awarded within initial bid validity period in the ten departments.

actual.value: Status: YR 1, YR2 and YR3: Achieved.

title.narrative: Improved cash management practices as measured by improved accuracy in cash flow forecasts

baseline.value: Monthly cash flow forecasts not prepared.

target.value: Cash flow forecasts prepared more accurately and error margins reduced to less than 10%.

actual.value: Status: delayed due to hiring of consultants. Proposed (Yr1 to Yr 2) to be shifted forward.

title.narrative: Strengthened tax administration in the CTD

baseline.value: Need to align institutional structure and processes in the CTD to evolving indirect tax regime.

actual.value: Status: Year 1 Achieved. Year 2 TNA completed. Report on institutionalizing training strategy and training courseware preparedYear 3 : Results obtained being reviewed

title.narrative: Decline in non/stop-filers in the CTD

baseline.value: Non/stop filers (annual returns) as percentage of active dealers. Baseline to be determined on the basis of FY 17-18 in FY 2018-19.

target.value: Risk to revenue managed by reducing the percentage of non/stop filers as percentage of registered active dealers to 15%.

title.narrative: Institutional strengthening (IS) of Local Fund Audit Department (LFAD)

baseline.value: Outdated audit manual and processes and no automation.

target.value: New framework followed in all Regional Offices of LFAD and audit process migrated to AMS

actual.value: Status: Year 1 indicator achieved. Year 2 partially achieved.Year 3: Target: • Risk-based audit methodology implemented acrossall Regional Offices of LFAD.• Audit Management Software (AMS) operationalized in headquarters and at least one Regional Office ofLFAD.• All technical staff of LFAD trained in the new framework.Status: Partially achieved.

title.narrative: Improved awareness of SPFC (percentage citing awareness in total users surveyed)

baseline.value: Survey done by Consumer Unity & Trust Society International (CUTS) (12% for SPFC)

target.value: Enhanced awareness of SPFC among stakeholders; survey to be conducted in Year 3 and Year 5.

title.narrative: Value of tax recoveries (reduction in arrears) in the CTD

baseline.value: Tax arrears for last three years at 57% of total arrears.

target.value: Tax arrears for last three years reduced to 30% of total arrears.

actual.value: Status: YR1, YR2 and YR3: Pending.

baseline.value: The average growth being the CGAR in the Excise Department revenue during past three years (from 2014-15 to 2016-17) is 12.46%.

target.value: Growth in Excise Department's revenue for FY 2021-22 over FY 2020-21 by 14.00%.

actual.value: Status: YR1 and YR2: Outstanding, but underway YR3: Pending.

baseline.value: The average growth in the Transport Department revenue during past four years (from 2013-14 to 2016-17) is 12.24%.

target.value: Growth in Transport Department's revenue for FY 2021-22 over FY 2020-21 by 14.00%.

actual.value: Status: YR1 and YR2: Achieved YR3: Pending.

title.narrative: Reduction in tender notice advertisement expenditure

baseline.value: The expenditure incurred in the Year 207-18 on NIT is 0.41% of the procurement value (Rs.27,000.00 cr.) during 2017-18.

target.value: Tender notice advertisement expenditure reduced up to 0.20% of the procurement value during 2020-21.

actual.value: Status: YR1, YR2 and YR3: Achieved

title.narrative: Implementation of a strengthened decentralized participatory planning process in Rajasthan

baseline.value: Weak decentralized participatory planning process and not linked to the annual budget process.

target.value: District level planning under strengthened framework mainstreamed in RDPR and DoP.

actual.value: Status: YR 1: Pending. YR2: Achieved. DP prepared for first pilot, but not on any software. YR3: Pending.

baseline.value: e-Procurement tender value in 2016-17 - INR 23,000 crores

actual.value: Status: YR1, YR2 and YR3: Achieved.
